DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Polyp Most Recent Diagnosis Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The diagnosis describing the most recent finding of the polypoid lesion that arises from the colon or rectum and protrudes into the lumen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A polypoid lesion that arises from the colon or rectum and protrudes into the lumen.  This group includes adenomatous polyps, serrated polyps, and hamartomatous polyps._Nearest to the present._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A polypoid lesion that arises from the colon or rectum and protrudes into the lumen.  This group includes adenomatous polyps, serrated polyps, and hamartomatous polyps.

Concepts.definition: A polypoid lesion that arises from the colon or rectum and protrudes into the lumen.  This group includes adenomatous polyps, serrated polyps, and hamartomatous polyps.
